item.title: 金融科技公司 Pine Labs 申请在印度上市
item.description: 周四的文件草案显示，印度金融科技公司Pine Labs已提交首次公开募股申请，该公司将发行价值260亿卢比（约合3.04亿美元）的新股。【原文：Indian fintech firm Pine Labs has filed for an initial public offering, draft papers showed on Thursday, with the company set to issue fresh shares worth 26 billion rupees ($304 million).】

item.title: 面对全球逆风，中国汽车制造商进军非洲
item.description: 由于对美国和欧洲的出口限制，中国汽车制造商开始在全球范围内寻找新的市场，他们正努力发掘非洲欠发达地区的潜力，并将重点放在电动汽车和混合动力汽车上。【原文：Chinese automakers are pushing to unlock Africa's underdeveloped potential, with a focus on electric and hybrid vehicles, as restrictions on exports to the United States and Europe send them on a global quest for new markets.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国饲料制造商签署了自2019年以来的首份阿根廷大宗豆粕协议
item.description: 周四，四位贸易消息人士告诉路透社，中国饲料制造商已预订 7 月份装运的 3 万吨阿根廷豆粕，这是中国自 2019 年批准进口阿根廷豆粕以来的首次此类采购。【原文：Chinese feed makers have booked a deal for 30,000 metric tons of Argentine soymeal for July shipment, marking the country's first such purchase since China granted import approval for the product in 2019, four trade sources told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 周三下跌 38% 后，Worldline 股价有所回升
item.description: 周四早盘，Worldline 的股价收复了部分失地，此前一家媒体财团的指控使该支付集团的股价在周三下跌了 38%，市值损失了 5 亿欧元（5.85 亿美元）。【原文：Worldline shares recovered some of their losses in early trade on Thursday, after allegations by a media consortium sent the payments group's stock falling by 38% on Wednesday, wiping out 500 million euros ($585 million) of its market value.】

item.title: 通用汽车因制动压力开关存在起火风险将召回超过 6.2 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，通用汽车将在美国召回62468辆汽车，因为汽车在行驶或停放过程中，制动压力开关的电气短路可能会增加起火风险。【原文：GM is recalling 62,468 vehicles in the U.S. as an electrical short in the brake pressure switch can increase the risk of a fire while the vehicle is driving or parked, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 印尼正在制定新的电子商务税收规则，以打击 "影子经济
item.description: 印度尼西亚税务局周四表示，为应对 "影子经济"，印尼正在制定一项新法规，要求电子商务平台收集和传递卖家的销售收入，这证实了路透社本周早些时候的报道。【原文：Indonesia is working on a new regulation that will require e-commerce platforms to collect and pass on sellers' sales income in a bid to tackle the "shadow economy", its tax office said on Thursday, confirming a Reuters report earlier this week.】

item.title: 壳牌称不考虑收购英国石油公司，英国规定禁止收购 6 个月
item.description: 壳牌周四表示，壳牌没有竞购英国石油公司，也没有积极考虑这一行动，并补充说，壳牌受到英国法规的约束，这些法规禁止壳牌在未来六个月内竞购英国石油公司。【原文：Shell has not bid for BP and is not actively considering such a move, it said on Thursday, adding it was bound by UK regulations which mean such a statement ban it from making a bid for BP for the next six months.】

item.title: H&M 称第二季度销售额降幅超过预期，购物者态度谨慎
item.description: 瑞典时装零售商 H&M 周四公布的第二季度销售额降幅略大于预期，并表示预计 6 月份以当地货币计算的销售额将增长 3%。【原文：Swedish fashion retailer H&M reported on Thursday a slightly bigger drop than expected in second-quarter sales and said it expected sales in June, measured in local currencies, to rise 3%.】

item.title: 大赦国际称柬埔寨助长了残暴的诈骗业
item.description: 人权组织大赦国际（Amnesty International）周四指责柬埔寨政府 "故意无视 "网络犯罪团伙的虐待行为，这些团伙从世界各地贩运人口，包括儿童，并在残忍的诈骗场所充当奴隶。【原文：Human rights group Amnesty International accused Cambodia’s government on Thursday of "deliberately ignoring" abuses by cybercrime gangs who have trafficked people from across the world, including children, into slavery at brutal scam compounds.】

item.title: 荷兰消费者团体准备对 Booking.com 采取法律行动，指控其抬高酒店价格
item.description: 两个荷兰消费者团体周三表示，他们正在寻找受影响的客户，以便对全球最大的在线旅行社之一 Booking.com 提出法律索赔，因为他们认为该公司自 2013 年以来抬高了酒店价格。【原文：Two Dutch consumer groups said on Wednesday they are seeking affected customers for a legal claim against Booking.com , one of the world's largest online travel agencies, over what they described as inflated hotel prices since 2013.】

item.title: 日本创下 2320 亿美元并购纪录，推动亚洲交易反弹
item.description: 2025 年，日本以创纪录的 2,320 亿美元交易额推动了亚洲并购市场的反弹，银行家们预计，在数十亿美元的私有化安排、对外投资和私募股权活动的推动下，这一趋势将持续下去。【原文：Japan is driving Asia's M&A rebound in 2025 with a record $232 billion worth of deals in the first half, and bankers expect the trend to sustain fuelled by multi-billion dollar take-private arrangements, outbound investments and private equity activity.】

item.title: 欧盟将在峰会上就解决美国关税冲突向各国领导人征求意见
item.description: 欧盟领导人将于周四告诉欧盟委员会，他们是希望以华盛顿获得更好的条件为代价与美国迅速达成贸易协议，还是希望将斗争升级以获得更好的结果。【原文：European Union leaders are to tell the European Commission on Thursday if they want a quick trade deal with the United States at the cost of Washington getting better terms, or to escalate the fight in hope of something better.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：挪威软件公司Visma选择在伦敦上市
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，挪威软件公司Visma已选定伦敦而非阿姆斯特丹作为其明年首次公开募股（IPO）的地点。【原文：Norwegian software company Visma has picked London over Amsterdam for its initial public offering (IPO) next year, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 外国人 12 周来首次转为净卖出日本股票
item.description: 在截至 6 月 21 日的一周内，由于对以色列-伊朗冲突及其对日本石油进口和通胀的影响持谨慎态度，外国人在 12 周内首次撤资日本股票。【原文：Foreigners divested Japanese stock for the first time in 12 weeks in the week through June 21 on caution over the Israel-Iran conflict and its impact on Japanese oil imports and inflation.】

item.title: 早间竞价特朗普抨击鲍威尔，美元反弹
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 投资者加强防御，防止八月市场再次暴跌
item.description: 由于油价波动或新关税冲击的风险可能会撼动市场的自满情绪，并引发去年 8 月股市暴跌的重演，大型投资者正以比往常更加谨慎的态度为未来几个月通常交投清淡的市场做准备。【原文：Big investors are preparing for the normally thinly-traded months ahead with even more caution than usual as risks of oil price volatility or fresh tariff shocks could shake up the complacent market mood and spark a repeat of last August's rout.】

item.title: 特朗普希望在 8930 亿美元的预算申请中增加无人机和导弹数量，减少 F-35 战斗机数量
item.description: 根据周三公布的预算材料，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）希望在明年的国防预算中为军队加薪，增加高科技导弹和无人机，同时削减海军职位，减少购买舰艇和战斗机以节省开支。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump wants a pay raise for troops, more high-tech missiles and drones in next year's defense budget, while cutting Navy jobs, and buying fewer ships and fighter jets to save money, according to budget materials posted Wednesday.】

item.title: 皮博迪延长澳大利亚海伦斯堡煤矿矿工停工期
item.description: 澳大利亚矿业与能源工会（MEU）周四表示，美国煤炭生产商皮博迪能源公司延长了对其位于新南威尔士州的海伦堡地下煤矿工人的停工期。【原文：U.S. coal producer Peabody Energy has extended a lockout of its workers at its Helensburgh underground coal mine in New South Wales, Australia's Mining and Energy Union (MEU) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Meta 聘请了三名 OpenAI 研究人员
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，Meta 首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）已聘请三名 OpenAI 研究人员加入其超级智能工作。【原文：Meta Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has hired three OpenAI researchers to join his superintelligence efforts, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亚洲股市犹豫不决，美元因特朗普抨击鲍威尔而下滑
item.description: 周四，投资者在权衡地缘政治、经济和财政不确定性的同时，也在为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税最后期限做准备。【原文：Asian stocks stuttered on Thursday, while oil prices stabilized and the euro was perched at a 3-1-2/-year high as investors weighed geopolitical, economic and fiscal uncertainties as they braced for U.S. President Donald Trump's deadline on tariffs.】

item.title: 澳大利亚统计局（ABS）数据显示，澳大利亚五月份季度职位空缺反弹 2.9
item.description: 周四的数据显示，在建筑和专业行业空缺职位的带动下，澳大利亚五月份的职位空缺出现反弹，这表明尽管经济疲软，但对劳动力的需求依然保持弹性。【原文：Job vacancies in Australia rebounded in the May quarter, led by openings in the construction and professional sectors, data showed on Thursday, in a sign demand for labour remained resilient despite a soft economy.】

item.title: 杰斐逊资本与现有股东在美国首次公开募股中募集 1.5 亿美元资金
item.description: 私募股权支持的杰斐逊资本公司（Jefferson Capital）及其现有投资者在纳斯达克首次公开募股中筹集了 1.5 亿美元，该公司周三在一份声明中表示，其股票定价为预期范围的下限。【原文：Private equity-backed Jefferson Capital and its existing investors raised $150 million in a Nasdaq initial public offering after pricing its shares at the lower end of the projected range, the firm said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，贝索斯在试图为蓝色起源争取更多政府合同时与特朗普进行了交谈
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，蓝色起源公司（Blue Origin）创始人杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）本月至少与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）谈了两次话，他试图利用竞争对手太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）创始人马斯克与特朗普之间的不和，争取更多的政府合同。【原文：Blue Origin founder Jeff Bezos spoke to U.S. President Donald Trump at least twice this month as he tries to capitalize on a feud between rival SpaceX founder Musk and Trump and bag more government contracts, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国原油库存减少预示需求坚挺，石油上涨
item.description: 油价走高，延续了前一天的涨势，原因是美国原油库存降幅大于预期，表明需求坚挺，而投资者对伊朗-以色列停火和中东地区的稳定仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Oil prices inched higher, extending gains from the previous day as a larger-than-expected draw in U.S. crude stocks signalled firm demand, while investors remained cautious about the Iran-Israel ceasefire and stability in the Middle East.】

item.title: 美国财政部贝森特延长避免突破债务上限的措施期限
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周三将财政部继续采取非常规现金管理措施以防止突破联邦债务上限的权限延长了近一个月，直至7月24日。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Wednesday extended the department's authority to continue extraordinary cash management measures to keep from breaching the federal debt ceiling by nearly a month, until July 24.】

item.title: 特朗普攻击威胁美联储信誉，美元创下新低
item.description: 由于对美国联邦储备局未来独立性的担忧削弱了人们对美国货币政策稳健性的信心，美元兑欧元汇率周四跌至3年半以来的新低。【原文：The dollar eased to a fresh 3-1/2-year low on the euro on Thursday as concerns about the future independence of the U.S. Federal Reserve undermined faith in the soundness of the country's monetary policy.】

item.title: Meta 挡住了作者就人工智能提起的美国版权诉讼
item.description: 旧金山的一名联邦法官周三做出了支持 Meta Platforms 公司的裁决，该公司起诉了一批作家，这些作家认为 Meta Platforms 未经许可使用他们的书籍来训练其人工智能系统侵犯了他们的版权。【原文：A federal judge in San Francisco ruled on Wednesday for Meta Platforms against a group of authors who had argued that its use of their books without permission to train its artificial intelligence system infringed their copyrights.】

item.title: 马姆达尼在纽约市长民主党初选中领先，令企业人心惶惶
item.description: 前一天，进步民主党人佐赫兰-马姆达尼（Zohran Mamdani）很可能在竞争激烈的市长初选中获胜。【原文：Business leaders in New York City voiced concerns on Wednesday, following progressive Democrat Zohran Mamdani's likely victory in the city's hotly contested primary for mayor the day before.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，微软与 OpenAI 就人工智能展开对决
item.description: 据 The Information 周三报道，微软和 OpenAI 在人工通用智能合同条款上存在分歧。【原文：Microsoft and OpenAI are at odds over a contractual provision related to artificial general intelligence, The Information reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会称玛氏 360 亿美元的凯兰诺华交易不构成反竞争
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周三表示，糖果巨头玛氏公司拟斥资 360 亿美元收购品客薯片生产商凯兰诺华公司的交易不符合反竞争兼并的标准，监管机构将结束对该交易的审查。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday that candy giant Mars' proposed $36 billion takeover of Pringles maker Kellanova did not meet the standard for an anticompetitive merger and that the regulator was ending its review of the deal.】
